2 Pejabat Mundur Usai Anggaran Janggal, William PSI Bilang Begini
04 Nov 2019, 01:10 by Imam Hamdi, Dwi Arjanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta -Anggota DPRD Fraksi PSI William Aditya Sarana menyesalkan pengunduran diri dua pejabat di Pemerintah Provinsi DKI Jakarta usai gaduh anggaran janggal di rancangan APBD 2020 Jakarta.
Kedua pejabat terimbas anggaran janggal yang akhir dihapus itu, adalah Kepala Badan Perencanaan Pembangunan Daerah DKI Jakarta Sri Mahendra dan Kepala Dinas Pariwisata dan Kebudayaan Edi Juanedi.
Keduanya mengundurkan diri dari jabatannya pada Kamis, 31 Oktober 2019 pekan lalu . "Sangat disayangkan pengunduran dirinya karena sedang dalam proses pembahasan APBD 2020," kata William melalui pesan singkat, Ahad, 3 November 2019.
William berharap gubernur DKI Jakarta segera mencari pengganti mereka agar pembahasan rancangan plafon anggaran 2020 bisa maksimal. Selain itu, ia berharap pejabat pengganti keduanya bisa beradaptasi cepat dalam proses pembahasan anggaran agar tidak terputus.
"Harus secepatnya mencari pengganti kedua pejabat yang mengundurkan diri tersebut."
Kedua kepala dinas tersebut mundur di tengah heboh pembahasan anggaran 2020. Dinas Pariwisata dan Kebudayaan DKI sempat menjadi sorotan karena usulan anggaran senilai Rp 5 miliar untuk influencer luar negeri dalam mempromosikan pariwisata Jakarta. Setelah mencuat ke publik anggaran tersebut telah dihapus.
"Jadi perlu saya luruskan bahwa Rp 5 miliar itu bukan untuk 5 influencer, tapi ada juga kegiatan-kegiatannya," kata Edi.
Selain anggaran influencer, anggaran janggal lainnya yang ditemukan di rancangan plafon anggaran Rp 82,8 miliar untuk membeli lem aibon di Suku Dinas Pendidikan Jakarta Barat, Rp 123 miliar pembelian pulpen di Sudin Pendidikan Jakarta Timur dan banyak lagi anggaran yang dianggap tidak masuk akal lainnya.
Gubernur DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan mengatakan belum mendapatkan keterangan langsung dari Edi Junaedi yang melepaskan jabatannya sebagai Kepala Dinas Pariwisata dan Kebudayaan pada Rabu, 31 Oktober 2019.
"Beliau (Edi) menyerahkan surat pengunduran diri, tapi belum ketemu dan belum ada informasi lebih jauh (terkait keputusannya mengundurkan diri)," kata Anies di Balai Kota DKI, Kamis, 1 November 2019.
Anies mengatakan belum bisa menemui Edi karena saat ini yang bersangkutan tidak berada di Jakarta karena menjenguk ibunya yang sakit. "Beliau tidak berada di Jakarta karena mengunjungi ibunya yang sedang sakit. Jadi kebetulan saja waktunya bersamaan."
Sedangkan, Mehendra, kata Anies, telah menyampaikan langsung kepadanya keputusanya mengundurkan diri dari jabatannya.
"Beliau sampaikan bahwa dia (Mahendra) akan aktif di sana dan di sini dia memilih untuk orang lain. saya bilang putusan itu kami hormati Pak Mahendra," ujarnya. Anies Baswedan mengatakan Mahendra bakal menjadi tenaga ahli dalam pendidikan dan pelatihan aparatur sipil negara di Pemprov DKI

2 Officials Resign After Odd Budget, William PSI Said This
Nov 04 2019, 01:10 by Imam Hamdi, Dwi Arjanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - DPRD member PSI Faction William Aditya Sarana deplores the resignation of two officials in the DKI Jakarta Provincial Government after an awkward budget in the Jakarta 2020 APBD draft.
The two officials affected by the odd budget that were finally removed, were the Head of DKI Jakarta Regional Development Planning Board Sri Mahendra and the Head of the Tourism and Culture Office Edi Juanedi.
Both of them resigned from their positions on Thursday, October 31, 2019 last week. "It is unfortunate that his resignation is in the process of discussing the 2020 regional budget," William said via text message, Sunday, November 3, 2019.
William hopes the DKI Jakarta governor will soon find their replacement so that the discussion on the 2020 budget ceiling design can be maximized. In addition, he hopes that the two replacement officials can adapt quickly in the budget discussion process so that they are not interrupted.
"Must immediately find a replacement for the two officials who resigned."
The two heads of service withdrew amidst the debates of the 2020 budget discussion. The Jakarta Tourism and Culture Office was in the spotlight because of a proposed budget of Rp 5 billion for foreign influencers in promoting Jakarta tourism. After sticking to the public the budget was removed.
"So I need to clarify that the Rp 5 billion is not for 5 influencers, but there are also activities," said Edi.
In addition to the influencer budget, another odd budget found in the ceiling design budget of Rp. 82.8 billion to buy aibon glue at the West Jakarta Education Agency, Rp. 123 billion for the purchase of pens at the East Jakarta Education Sub-Department and many other considered unreasonable budgets.
DKI Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan said that he had not yet received a direct statement from Edi Junaedi who gave up his position as Head of Tourism and Culture on Wednesday, 31 October 2019.
"He (Edi) submitted a letter of resignation, but has not yet found and there is no further information (related to his decision to resign)," Anies said at the City Hall of DKI, Thursday, November 1, 2019.
Anies said that he could not yet meet Edi because he was not currently in Jakarta because he was visiting his ailing mother. "He was not in Jakarta because he visited his mother who was sick. So it just happened to be the same time."
Meanwhile, Mehendra, said Anies, had conveyed directly to him his decision to resign from his post.
"He said that he (Mahendra) would be active there and here he chose for others. I said that we respect Mr. Mahendra's decision," he said. Anies Baswedan said Mahendra would become an expert in the education and training of the state civil apparatus in the DKI Jakarta Provincial Government
